abstract: FIFA, embracing role as victim of its leaders' crimes, asks Justice Dept for share of hundreds of millions of dollars that authorities stand to collect from former FIFA officials who have pleaded guilty to corruption.

headline.print_headline: Seeking Millions, FIFA Has Bigger Aim
headline.main: FIFA, Embracing Role as Victim, Seeks to Collect Millions in U.S. Case

keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: FIFA asked the Justice Department for a share of the hundreds of millions that authorities stand to collect from defendants who have pleaded guilty to corruption.
lead_paragraph: FIFA asked the Justice Department for a share of the hundreds of millions that authorities stand to collect from defendants who have pleaded guilty to corruption.
